Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the notion that the trade deficit with Japan is "changing rapidly" when in fact it has only increased slightly under Trump.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence to prove that the trade deficit with Japan is changing rapidly.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the trade deficit with Japan is not changing rapidly, but rather has only increased slightly.
Understate: The claim understates the actual increase in the trade deficit with Japan under Trump.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the trade deficit with Japan that are not mentioned in the claim.
